   21: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------------
   22: %%% File    : node_container_SUITE.erl
   23: %%% Author  : Rickard <rickard.green@uab.ericsson.se>
   24: %%% Purpose : 
   25: %%% Created : 24 Jul 2002 by Rickard <rickard.green@uab.ericsson.se>
   26: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------------
   27: 
   28: -module(node_container_SUITE).
   29: -author('rickard.green@uab.ericsson.se').
   30: 
   31: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   32: 
   33: -export([all/0, suite/0, init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1,
   34:          init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2,
   35:          node_container_refc_check/1]).
   36: 
   37: -export([term_to_binary_to_term_eq/1,
   38:          round_trip_eq/1,
   39:          cmp/1,
   40:          ref_eq/1,
   41:          node_table_gc/1,
   42:          dist_link_refc/1,
   43:          dist_monitor_refc/1,
   44:          node_controller_refc/1,
   45:          ets_refc/1,
   46:          match_spec_refc/1,
   47:          timer_refc/1,
   48:          pid_wrap/1,
   49:          port_wrap/1,
   50:          bad_nc/1,
   51:          unique_pid/1,
   52:          iter_max_procs/1,
   53:          magic_ref/1,
   54:          dist_entry_gc/1,
   55:          persistent_term/1,
   56:          huge_ref/1]).
   57: 
   58: suite() ->
   59:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   60:      {timetrap, {minutes, 12}}].
   61: 
   62: 
   63: all() -> 
   64:     [dist_entry_gc, term_to_binary_to_term_eq, round_trip_eq, cmp, ref_eq,
   65:      node_table_gc, dist_link_refc, dist_monitor_refc,
   66:      node_controller_refc, ets_refc, match_spec_refc,
   67:      timer_refc, pid_wrap, port_wrap, bad_nc,
   68:      unique_pid, iter_max_procs,
   69:      magic_ref, persistent_term, huge_ref].
   70: 
   71: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   72:     Config.
   73: 
   74: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   75:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true),
   76:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(node_tab_delayed_delete, -1), %% restore original value
   77:     erts_test_utils:available_internal_state(false).
   78: 
   79: init_per_testcase(_Case, Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   80:     erts_test_utils:available_internal_state(true),
   81:     Config.
   82: 
   83: end_per_testcase(_Case, Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   84:     erts_test_utils:ept_check_leaked_nodes(Config).
   85: 
   86: %%%
   87: %%% The test cases -------------------------------------------------------------
   88: %%%
   89: 
   90: -define(MAX_PIDS_PORTS, ((1 bsl 28) - 1)).
   91: 
   92: %%
   93: %% Test case: term_to_binary_to_term_eq
   94: %%
   95: %% Tests that node container terms that are converted to external format
   96: %% and back stay equal to themselves.
   97: term_to_binary_to_term_eq(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   98:     ThisNode = {node(), erlang:system_info(creation)},
   99:     % Get local node containers
  100:     LPid = self(),
  101:     LXPid = mk_pid(ThisNode, 32767, 8191),
  102:     LPort = hd(erlang:ports()),
  103:     LXPort = mk_port(ThisNode, 268435455),
  104:     LLRef = make_ref(),
  105:     LHLRef = mk_ref(ThisNode, [47, 11]),
  106:     LSRef = mk_ref(ThisNode, [4711]),
  107:     % Test local nc:s
  108:     LPid = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(LPid)),
  109:     LXPid = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(LXPid)),
  110:     LPort = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(LPort)),
  111:     LXPort = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(LXPort)),
  112:     LLRef = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(LLRef)),
  113:     LHLRef = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(LHLRef)),
  114:     LSRef = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(LSRef)),
  115:     % Get remote node containers
  116:     ttbtteq_do_remote({get_nodename(), 3}),
  117:     ttbtteq_do_remote({get_nodename(), 4}),
  118:     ttbtteq_do_remote({get_nodename(), 16#adec0ded}),
  119:     nc_refc_check(node()),
  120:     ok.
  121: 
  122: ttbtteq_do_remote(RNode) ->
  123:     RPid = mk_pid(RNode, 4711, 1),
  124:     RXPid = mk_pid(RNode, 32767, 8191),
  125:     RPort = mk_port(RNode, 4711),
  126:     RXPort = mk_port(RNode, 268435455),
  127:     RXPort2 = case RNode of
  128: 		  {_, C} when C < 4 ->
  129: 		      mk_port(RNode, 4711);
  130: 		  _ ->
  131: 		      mk_port(RNode, (1 bsl 51) + 4711)
  132: 	      end,
  133:     RLRef = mk_ref(RNode, [4711, 4711, 4711]),
  134:     RHLRef = mk_ref(RNode, [4711, 4711]),
  135:     RSRef = mk_ref(RNode, [4711]),
  136:     % Test remote nc:s
  137:     RPid = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(RPid)),
  138:     RXPid = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(RXPid)),
  139:     RPort = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(RPort)),
  140:     RXPort = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(RXPort)),
  141:     RXPort2 = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(RXPort2)),
  142:     RLRef = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(RLRef)),
  143:     RHLRef = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(RHLRef)),
  144:     RSRef = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(RSRef)),
  145:     ok.
  146: 
  147: 
  148: %%
  149: %% Test case: round_trip_eq
  150: %%
  151: %% Tests that node containers that are sent between nodes stay equal to themselves.
  152: round_trip_eq(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  153:     ThisNode = {node(), erlang:system_info(creation)},
  154:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  155:     Self = self(),
  156:     RPid = spawn_link(Node,
  157:                       fun () ->
  158:                               receive
  159:                                   {Self, Data} ->
  160:                                       Self ! {self(), Data}
  161:                               end
  162:                       end),
  163:     SentPid = self(),
  164:     SentXPid = mk_pid(ThisNode, 17471, 8190),
  165:     SentPort = hd(erlang:ports()),
  166:     SentXPort = mk_port(ThisNode, 268435451),
  167:     SentXPort2 = mk_port({Node, 4711}, (1 bsl 49) + 4711),
  168:     SentLRef = make_ref(),
  169:     SentHLRef = mk_ref(ThisNode, [4711, 17]),
  170:     SentSRef = mk_ref(ThisNode, [4711]),
  171:     RPid ! {Self, {SentPid,
  172:                    SentXPid,
  173:                    SentPort,
  174:                    SentXPort,
  175:                    SentXPort2,
  176:                    SentLRef,
  177:                    SentHLRef,
  178:                    SentSRef}},
  179:     receive
  180:         {RPid, {RecPid,
  181:                 RecXPid,
  182:                 RecPort,
  183:                 RecXPort,
  184:                 RecXPort2,
  185:                 RecLRef,
  186:                 RecHLRef,
  187:                 RecSRef}} ->
  188:             stop_node(Peer, Node),
  189:             SentPid = RecPid,
  190:             SentXPid = RecXPid,
  191:             SentPort = RecPort,
  192:             SentXPort = RecXPort,
  193:             SentXPort2 = RecXPort2,
  194:             SentLRef = RecLRef,
  195:             SentHLRef = RecHLRef,
  196:             SentSRef = RecSRef,
  197:             nc_refc_check(node()),
  198:             ok
  199:     end.
  200: 
  201: 
  202: 
  203: %%
  204: %% Test case: cmp
  205: %%
  206: %% Tests that Erlang term comparison works as it should on node containers.
  207: cmp(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  208: 
  209:     %% Inter type comparison ---------------------------------------------------
  210: 
  211:     %% The Erlang term order:
  212:     %% number < atom < ref < fun < port < pid < tuple < nil < cons < binary
  213:     RNode = {get_nodename(), 2},
  214: 
  215:     IRef = make_ref(),
  216:     ERef = mk_ref({get_nodename(), 2}, [1,2,3]),
  217: 
  218:     IPid = self(),
  219:     EPid = mk_pid(RNode, 1, 2),
  220: 
  221:     IPort = hd(erlang:ports()),
  222:     EPort = mk_port(RNode, 1),
  223: 
  224:     %% Test pids ----------------------------------------------------
  225:     true = 1 < IPid,
  226:     true = 1.3 < IPid,
  227:     true = (1 bsl 64) < IPid,
  228:     true = an_atom < IPid,
  229:     true = IRef < IPid,
  230:     true = ERef < IPid,
  231:     true = fun () -> a_fun end < IPid,
  232:     true = IPort < IPid,
  233:     true = EPort < IPid,
  234:     true = IPid < {a, tuple},
  235:     true = IPid < [],
  236:     true = IPid < [a|cons],
  237:     true = IPid < <<"a binary">>,
  238: 
  239:     true = 1 < EPid,
  240:     true = 1.3 < EPid,
  241:     true = (1 bsl 64) < EPid,
  242:     true = an_atom < EPid,
  243:     true = IRef < EPid,
  244:     true = ERef < EPid,
  245:     true = fun () -> a_fun end < EPid,
  246:     true = IPort < EPid,
  247:     true = EPort < EPid,
  248:     true = EPid < {a, tuple},
  249:     true = EPid < [],
  250:     true = EPid < [a|cons],
  251:     true = EPid < <<"a binary">>,
  252: 
  253:     %% Test ports --------------------------------------------------
  254:     true = 1 < IPort,
  255:     true = 1.3 < IPort,
  256:     true = (1 bsl 64) < IPort,
  257:     true = an_atom < IPort,
  258:     true = IRef < IPort,
  259:     true = ERef < IPort,
  260:     true = fun () -> a_fun end < IPort,
  261:     true = IPort < IPid,
  262:     true = IPort < EPid,
  263:     true = IPort < {a, tuple},
  264:     true = IPort < [],
  265:     true = IPort < [a|cons],
  266:     true = IPort < <<"a binary">>,
  267: 
  268:     true = 1 < EPort,
  269:     true = 1.3 < EPort,
  270:     true = (1 bsl 64) < EPort,
  271:     true = an_atom < EPort,
  272:     true = IRef < EPort,
  273:     true = ERef < EPort,
  274:     true = fun () -> a_fun end < EPort,
  275:     true = EPort < IPid,
  276:     true = EPort < EPid,
  277:     true = EPort < {a, tuple},
  278:     true = EPort < [],
  279:     true = EPort < [a|cons],
  280:     true = EPort < <<"a binary">>,
  281: 
  282:     %% Test refs ----------------------------------------------------
  283:     true = 1 < IRef,
  284:     true = 1.3 < IRef,
  285:     true = (1 bsl 64) < IRef,
  286:     true = an_atom < IRef,
  287:     true = IRef < fun () -> a_fun end,
  288:     true = IRef < IPort,
  289:     true = IRef < EPort,
  290:     true = IRef < IPid,
  291:     true = IRef < EPid,
  292:     true = IRef < {a, tuple},
  293:     true = IRef < [],
  294:     true = IRef < [a|cons],
  295:     true = IRef < <<"a binary">>,
  296: 
  297:     true = 1 < ERef,
  298:     true = 1.3 < ERef,
  299:     true = (1 bsl 64) < ERef,
  300:     true = an_atom < ERef,
  301:     true = ERef < fun () -> a_fun end,
  302:     true = ERef < IPort,
  303:     true = ERef < EPort,
  304:     true = ERef < IPid,
  305:     true = ERef < EPid,
  306:     true = ERef < {a, tuple},
  307:     true = ERef < [],
  308:     true = ERef < [a|cons],
  309:     true = ERef < <<"a binary">>,
  310: 
  311: 
  312:     %% Intra type comparison ---------------------------------------------------
  313: 
  314: 
  315:     %% Test pids ----------------------------------------------------
  316:     %%
  317:     %% Significance (most -> least):
  318:     %%   serial, number, nodename, creation
  319:     %%
  320: 
  321:     Pid = mk_pid({b@b, 2}, 4711, 1),
  322: 
  323:     true = mk_pid({a@b, 1}, 4710, 2) > Pid,
  324:     true = mk_pid({a@b, 1}, 4712, 1) > Pid,
  325:     true = mk_pid({c@b, 1}, 4711, 1) > Pid,
  326:     true = mk_pid({b@b, 3}, 4711, 1) > Pid,
  327:     true = mk_pid({b@b, 2}, 4711, 1) =:= Pid,
  328: 
  329:     %% Test big external pids (> OTP-24)
  330:     MaxPidNum = (1 bsl 15) - 1,
  331:     MaxPidSer = ?MAX_PIDS_PORTS bsr 15,
  332:     true = mk_pid({b@b, 2}, 4711, MaxPidSer) < mk_pid({a@b, 1}, 4710, MaxPidSer+1),
  333:     true = mk_pid({b@b, 2}, 4711, MaxPidSer) < mk_pid({a@b, 1}, 4710, (1 bsl 31)),
  334:     true = mk_pid({b@b, 2}, 4711, MaxPidSer) < mk_pid({a@b, 1}, 4710, (1 bsl 32)-1),
  335: 
  336:     true = mk_pid({b@b, 2}, MaxPidNum, 17) < mk_pid({a@b, 1}, MaxPidNum+1, 17),
  337:     true = mk_pid({b@b, 2}, MaxPidNum, 17) < mk_pid({a@b, 1}, (1 bsl 31), 17),
  338:     true = mk_pid({b@b, 2}, MaxPidNum, 17) < mk_pid({a@b, 1}, (1 bsl 32)-1, 17),
  339: 
  340:     true = mk_pid({b@b, 2}, 4711, 17) < mk_pid({b@b, 4}, 4711, 17),
  341:     true = mk_pid({b@b, 2}, 4711, 17) < mk_pid({b@b, (1 bsl 31)}, 4711, 17),
  342:     true = mk_pid({b@b, 2}, 4711, 17) < mk_pid({b@b, (1 bsl 32)-1}, 4711, 17),
  343: 
  344: 
  345:     %% Test ports ---------------------------------------------------
  346:     %%
  347:     %% Significance (most -> least):
  348:     %%   nodename, creation, number 
  349:     %%
  350:     %% OBS: Comparison between ports has changed in R9. This
  351:     %%      since it wasn't stable in R8 (and eariler releases).
  352:     %%      Significance used to be: dist_slot, number,
  353:     %%      creation.
  354: 
  355:     Port = mk_port({b@b, 2}, 4711),
  356: 
  357:     true = mk_port({c@b, 1}, 4710) > Port,
  358:     true = mk_port({b@b, 3}, 4710) > Port,
  359:     true = mk_port({b@b, 2}, 4712) > Port,
  360:     true = mk_port({b@b, 2}, 4711) =:= Port,
  361: 
  362:     %% Test refs ----------------------------------------------------
  363:     %% Significance (most -> least):
  364:     %% nodename, creation, (number high, number mid), number low, 
  365:     %%
  366:     %% OBS: Comparison between refs has changed in R9. This
  367:     %%      since it wasn't stable in R8 (and eariler releases).
  368:     %%      Significance used to be: dist_slot, number,
  369:     %%      creation.
  370:     %%
  371: 
  372:     Ref = mk_ref({b@b, 2}, [4711, 4711, 4711]),
  373: 
  374:     true = mk_ref({c@b, 1}, [4710, 4710, 4710]) > Ref,
  375:     true = mk_ref({b@b, 3}, [4710, 4710, 4710]) > Ref,
  376:     true = mk_ref({b@b, 2}, [4710, 4710, 4712]) > Ref,
  377:     true = mk_ref({b@b, 2}, [4710, 4712, 4711]) > Ref,
  378:     true = mk_ref({b@b, 2}, [4712, 4711, 4711]) > Ref,
  379:     true = mk_ref({b@b, 2}, [4711, 4711, 4711]) =:= Ref,
  380: 
  381:     ok.
  382: 
  383: %%
  384: %% Test case: ref_eq
  385: %%
  386: %% Test that one word refs works
  387: ref_eq(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  388:     ThisNode = {node(), erlang:system_info(creation)},
  389:     AnotherNode = {get_nodename(),2},
  390:     LLongRef = mk_ref(ThisNode, [4711, 0, 0]),
  391:     LHalfLongRef = mk_ref(ThisNode, [4711, 0]),
  392:     LShortRef = mk_ref(ThisNode, [4711]),
  393:     true = LLongRef =:= LShortRef,
  394:     true = LLongRef =:= LHalfLongRef,
  395:     true = LLongRef =:= LLongRef,
  396:     true = LHalfLongRef =:= LShortRef,
  397:     true = LHalfLongRef =:= LHalfLongRef,
  398:     true = LShortRef =:= LShortRef,
  399:     false = LShortRef == mk_ref(ThisNode, [4711, 0, 1]), % Not any more
  400:     RLongRef = mk_ref(AnotherNode, [4711, 0, 0]),
  401:     RHalfLongRef = mk_ref(AnotherNode, [4711, 0]),
  402:     RShortRef = mk_ref(AnotherNode, [4711]),
  403:     true = RLongRef =:= RShortRef,
  404:     true = RLongRef =:= RHalfLongRef,
  405:     true = RLongRef =:= RLongRef,
  406:     true = RHalfLongRef =:= RShortRef,
  407:     true = RHalfLongRef =:= RHalfLongRef,
  408:     true = RShortRef =:= RShortRef,
  409:     false = RShortRef == mk_ref(AnotherNode, [4711, 0, 1]), % Not any more
  410:     nc_refc_check(node()),
  411:     ok.
  412: 
  413: %%
  414: %% Test case: node_table_gc
  415: %%
  416: %% Tests that node tables are garbage collected.
  417: node_table_gc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  418:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true),
  419:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(node_tab_delayed_delete, 0),
  420:     PreKnown = nodes(known),
  421:     io:format("PreKnown = ~p~n", [PreKnown]),
  422:     make_node_garbage(0, 200000, 1000, []),
  423:     receive after 1000 -> ok end, %% Wait for thread progress...
  424:     PostKnown = nodes(known),
  425:     PostAreas = erlang:system_info(allocated_areas),
  426:     io:format("PostKnown = ~p~n", [PostKnown]),
  427:     io:format("PostAreas = ~p~n", [PostAreas]),
  428:     true = length(PostKnown) =< length(PreKnown),
  429:     nc_refc_check(node()),
  430:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(node_tab_delayed_delete, -1), %% restore original value
  431:     ok.
  432: 
  433: make_node_garbage(N, L, I, Ps) when N < L ->
  434:     Self = self(),
  435:     P = spawn_link(fun () ->
  436:                            % Generate two node entries and one dist
  437:                            % entry per node name
  438:                            PL1 = make_faked_pid_list(N,
  439:                                                      I div 2,
  440:                                                      1),
  441:                            put(a, PL1),
  442:                            PL2 = make_faked_pid_list(N,
  443:                                                      I div 2,
  444:                                                      2),
  445:                            put(b, PL2),
  446:                            Self ! {self(), length(nodes(known))}
  447:                    end),
  448:     receive
  449:         {P, KnownLength} ->
  450:             true = KnownLength >= I div 2
  451:     end,
  452:     make_node_garbage(N+(I div 2)*2, L, I, [P|Ps]);
  453: make_node_garbage(_, _, _, Ps) ->
  454:     %% Cleanup garbage...
  455:     ProcIsCleanedUp
  456:     = fun (Proc) ->
  457:               undefined == erts_debug:get_internal_state({process_status,
  458:                                                           Proc})
  459:       end,
  460:     lists:foreach(fun (P) -> wait_until(fun () -> ProcIsCleanedUp(P) end) end,
  461:                   Ps),
  462:     ok.
  463: 
  464: 
  465: make_faked_pid_list(Start, No, Creation) ->
  466:     make_faked_pid_list(Start, No, Creation, []).
  467: 
  468: make_faked_pid_list(_Start, 0, _Creation, Acc) ->
  469:     Acc;
  470: make_faked_pid_list(Start, No, Creation, Acc) ->
  471:     make_faked_pid_list(Start+1,
  472:                         No-1,
  473:                         Creation,
  474:                         [mk_pid({"faked_node-"
  475:                                  ++ integer_to_list(Start rem 50000)
  476:                                  ++ "@"
  477:                                  ++ atom_to_list(?MODULE),
  478:                                  Creation},
  479:                                 4711,
  480:                                 3) | Acc]).
  481: 
  482: %%
  483: %% Test case: dist_link_refc
  484: %%
  485: %% Tests that external reference counts are incremented and decremented
  486: %% as they should for distributed links
  487: dist_link_refc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  488:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  489:     RP = spawn_execer(Node),
  490:     LP = spawn_link_execer(node()),
  491:     true = sync_exec(RP, fun () -> link(LP) end),
  492:     wait_until(fun () ->
  493:                        {links, Links} = process_info(LP, links),
  494:                        lists:member(RP, Links)
  495:                end),
  496:     NodeCre = sync_exec(RP, fun() -> erlang:system_info(creation) end),
  497:     1 = reference_type_count(
  498:           link,
  499:           refering_entity_id({process, LP},
  500:                              get_node_references({Node, NodeCre}))),
  501:     exec(RP, fun() -> exit(normal) end),
  502:     wait_until(fun () ->
  503:                        {links, Links} = process_info(LP, links),
  504:                        not lists:member(RP, Links)
  505:                end),
  506:     0 = reference_type_count(
  507:           link,
  508:           refering_entity_id({process, LP},
  509:                              get_node_references({Node, NodeCre}))),
  510:     exit(LP, normal),
  511:     stop_node(Peer, Node),
  512:     nc_refc_check(node()),
  513:     ok.
  514: 
  515: 
  516: %%
  517: %% Test case: dist_monitor_refc
  518: %%
  519: %% Tests that external reference counts are incremented and decremented
  520: %% as they should for distributed monitors
  521: dist_monitor_refc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  522:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  523:     RP = spawn_execer(Node),
  524:     LP = spawn_link_execer(node()),
  525:     RMon = sync_exec(RP, fun () -> erlang:monitor(process, LP) end),
  526:     true = is_reference(RMon),
  527:     LMon = sync_exec(LP, fun () -> erlang:monitor(process, RP) end),
  528:     true = is_reference(LMon),
  529:     NodeCre = sync_exec(RP, fun() -> erlang:system_info(creation) end),
  530:     wait_until(fun () ->
  531:                        {monitored_by, MonBy}
  532:                        = process_info(LP, monitored_by),
  533:                        {monitors, Mon}
  534:                        = process_info(LP, monitors),
  535:                        (lists:member(RP, MonBy)
  536:                         and lists:member({process,RP}, Mon))
  537:                end),
  538:     3 = reference_type_count(
  539:           monitor,
  540:           refering_entity_id({process, LP},
  541:                              get_node_references({Node, NodeCre}))),
  542:     exec(RP, fun () -> exit(normal) end),
  543:     wait_until(fun () ->
  544:                        {monitored_by, MonBy}
  545:                        = process_info(LP, monitored_by),
  546:                        {monitors, Mon}
  547:                        = process_info(LP, monitors),
  548:                        ((not lists:member(RP, MonBy))
  549:                         and (not lists:member({process,RP}, Mon)))
  550:                end),
  551:     ok = sync_exec(LP,
  552:                    fun () ->
  553:                            receive
  554:                                {'DOWN', LMon, process, _, _} ->
  555:                                    ok
  556:                            end
  557:                    end),
  558:     0 = reference_type_count(
  559:           link,
  560:           refering_entity_id({process, LP},
  561:                              get_node_references({Node, NodeCre}))),
  562:     exit(LP, normal),
  563:     stop_node(Peer, Node),
  564:     nc_refc_check(node()),
  565:     ok.
  566: 
  567: 
  568: %%
  569: %% Test case: node_controller_refc
  570: %%
  571: %% Tests that external reference counts are incremented and decremented
  572: %% as they should for entities controlling a connections.
  573: node_controller_refc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  574:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true),
  575:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(node_tab_delayed_delete, 0),
  576:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  577:     true = lists:member(Node, nodes()),
  578:     1 = reference_type_count(control, get_dist_references(Node)),
  579:     P = spawn_link_execer(node()),
  580:     Node
  581:     = sync_exec(P,
  582:                 fun () ->
  583:                         put(remote_net_kernel,
  584:                             rpc:call(Node,erlang,whereis,[net_kernel])),
  585:                         node(get(remote_net_kernel))
  586:                 end),
  587:     Creation = rpc:call(Node, erlang, system_info, [creation]),
  588:     monitor_node(Node,true),
  589:     stop_node(Peer, Node),
  590:     receive {nodedown, Node} -> ok end,
  591:     DistRefs = get_dist_references(Node),
  592:     true = reference_type_count(node, DistRefs) > 0,
  593:     0 = reference_type_count(control, DistRefs),
  594:     % Get rid of all references to Node
  595:     exec(P, fun () -> exit(normal) end),
  596:     wait_until(fun () -> not is_process_alive(P) end),
  597:     lists:foreach(fun (Proc) -> garbage_collect(Proc) end, processes()),
  598:     false = get_node_references({Node,Creation}),
  599:     wait_until(fun () ->
  600:                        case get_dist_references(Node) of
  601:                            false ->
  602:                                true;
  603:                            [{{system,thread_progress_delete_timer},
  604:                              [{system,1}]}] ->
  605:                                false;
  606:                            Other ->
  607:                                ct:fail(Other)
  608:                        end
  609:                end),
  610:     false = lists:member(Node, nodes(known)),
  611:     nc_refc_check(node()),
  612:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(node_tab_delayed_delete, -1), %% restore original value
  613:     ok.
  614: 
  615: %%
  616: %% Test case: ets_refc
  617: %%
  618: %% Tests that external reference counts are incremented and decremented
  619: %% as they should for data stored in ets tables.
  620: ets_refc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  621:     RNode = {get_nodename(), 1},
  622:     RPid = mk_pid(RNode, 4711, 2),
  623:     RPort = mk_port(RNode, 4711),
  624:     RRef = mk_ref(RNode, [4711, 47, 11]),
  625:     Tab = ets:new(ets_refc, []),
  626:     0 = reference_type_count(ets, get_node_references(RNode)),
  627:     true = ets:insert(Tab, [{a, self()},
  628:                             {b, RPid},
  629:                             {c, hd(erlang:ports())},
  630:                             {d, RPort},
  631:                             {e, make_ref()}]),
  632:     2 = reference_type_count(ets, get_node_references(RNode)),
  633:     true = ets:insert(Tab, {f, RRef}),
  634:     3 = reference_type_count(ets, get_node_references(RNode)),
  635:     true = ets:delete(Tab, d),
  636:     2 = reference_type_count(ets, get_node_references(RNode)),
  637:     true = ets:delete_all_objects(Tab),
  638:     0 = reference_type_count(ets, get_node_references(RNode)),
  639:     true = ets:insert(Tab, [{b, RPid}, {e, make_ref()}]),
  640:     1 = reference_type_count(ets, get_node_references(RNode)),
  641:     true = ets:delete(Tab),
  642:     0 = reference_type_count(ets, get_node_references(RNode)),
  643:     nc_refc_check(node()),
  644:     ok.
  645: 
  646: %%
  647: %% Test case: match_spec_refc
  648: %%
  649: %% Tests that external reference counts are incremented and decremented
  650: %% as they should for data stored in match specifications.
  651: match_spec_refc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  652:     RNode = {get_nodename(), 1},
  653:     RPid = mk_pid(RNode, 4711, 2),
  654:     RPort = mk_port(RNode, 4711),
  655:     RRef = mk_ref(RNode, [4711, 47, 11]),
  656:     ok = do_match_spec_test(RNode, RPid, RPort, RRef),
  657:     garbage_collect(),
  658:     NodeRefs = get_node_references(RNode),
  659:     0 = reference_type_count(binary, NodeRefs),
  660:     0 = reference_type_count(ets, NodeRefs),
  661:     nc_refc_check(node()),
  662:     ok.
  663: 
  664: do_match_spec_test(RNode, RPid, RPort, RRef) ->
  665:     Tab = ets:new(match_spec_refc, []),
  666:     true = ets:insert(Tab, [{a, RPid, RPort, RRef},
  667:                             {b, self(), RPort, RRef},
  668:                             {c, RPid, RPort, make_ref()},
  669:                             {d, RPid, RPort, RRef}]),
  670:     {M1, C1} = ets:select(Tab, [{{'$1',RPid,RPort,RRef},[],['$1']}], 1),
  671:     NodeRefs = get_node_references(RNode),
  672:     3 = reference_type_count(binary, NodeRefs),
  673:     10 = reference_type_count(ets, NodeRefs),
  674:     {M2, C2} = ets:select(C1),
  675:     '$end_of_table' = ets:select(C2),
  676:     ets:delete(Tab),
  677:     [a,d] = lists:sort(M1++M2),
  678:     ok.
  679: 
  680: 
  681: %%
  682: %% Test case: ets_refc
  683: %%
  684: %% Tests that external reference counts are incremented and decremented
  685: %% as they should for data stored in bif timers.
  686: timer_refc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  687:     RNode = {get_nodename(), 1},
  688:     RPid = mk_pid(RNode, 4711, 2),
  689:     RPort = mk_port(RNode, 4711),
  690:     RRef = mk_ref(RNode, [4711, 47, 11]),
  691:     0 = reference_type_count(timer, get_node_references(RNode)),
  692:     Pid = spawn(fun () -> receive after infinity -> ok end end),
  693:     erlang:start_timer(10000, Pid, {RPid, RPort, RRef}),
  694:     3 = reference_type_count(timer, get_node_references(RNode)),
  695:     exit(Pid, kill),
  696:     Mon = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
  697:     receive {'DOWN', Mon, process, Pid, _} -> ok end,
  698:     0 = reference_type_count(timer, get_node_references(RNode)),
  699:     erlang:send_after(500, Pid, {timer, RPid, RPort, RRef}),
  700:     0 = reference_type_count(timer, get_node_references(RNode)),
  701:     erlang:send_after(500, self(), {timer, RPid, RPort, RRef}),
  702:     erlang:send_after(400, bananfluga, {timer, RPid, RPort, RRef}),
  703:     6 = reference_type_count(timer, get_node_references(RNode)),
  704:     receive {timer, RPid, RPort, RRef} -> ok end,
  705:     0 = reference_type_count(timer, get_node_references(RNode)),
  706:     nc_refc_check(node()),
  707:     ok.
  708: 
  709: pid_wrap(Config) when is_list(Config) -> pp_wrap(pid).
  710: 
  711: port_wrap(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  712:     case os:type() of
  713:         {unix, _} ->
  714:             pp_wrap(port);
  715:         _ ->
  716:             {skip, "Only run on unix"}
  717:     end.
  718: 
  719: get_next_id(pid) ->
  720:     erts_debug:get_internal_state(next_pid);
  721: get_next_id(port) ->
  722:     erts_debug:get_internal_state(next_port).
  723: 
  724: set_next_id(pid, N) ->
  725:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(next_pid, N);
  726: set_next_id(port, N) ->
  727:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(next_port, N).
  728: 
  729: pp_wrap(What) ->
  730:     N = set_high_pp_next(What),
  731:     Cre = N + 100,
  732:     io:format("no creations = ~p~n", [Cre]),
  733:     PreCre = get_next_id(What),
  734:     io:format("pre creations = ~p~n", [PreCre]),
  735:     true = is_integer(PreCre),
  736:     do_pp_creations(What, Cre),
  737:     PostCre = get_next_id(What),
  738:     io:format("post creations = ~p~n", [PostCre]),
  739:     true = is_integer(PostCre),
  740:     true = PreCre > PostCre,
  741:     Now = set_next_id(What, ?MAX_PIDS_PORTS div 2),
  742:     io:format("reset to = ~p~n", [Now]),
  743:     true = is_integer(Now),
  744:     ok.
  745: 
  746: set_high_pp_next(What) ->
  747:     set_high_pp_next(What, ?MAX_PIDS_PORTS-1).
  748: 
  749: set_high_pp_next(What, N) ->
  750:     M = set_next_id(What, N),
  751:     true = is_integer(M),
  752:     case {M >= N, M =< ?MAX_PIDS_PORTS} of
  753:         {true, true} ->
  754:             ?MAX_PIDS_PORTS - M + 1;
  755:         _ ->
  756:             set_high_pp_next(What, N - 100)
  757:     end.
  758: 
  759: do_pp_creations(_What, N) when is_integer(N), N =< 0 ->
  760:     done;
  761: do_pp_creations(pid, N) when is_integer(N) ->
  762:     %% Create new pid and make sure it works...
  763:     Me = self(),
  764:     Ref = make_ref(),
  765:     Pid = spawn_link(fun () ->
  766:                              receive
  767:                                  Ref ->
  768:                                      Me ! Ref
  769:                              end
  770:                      end),
  771:     Pid ! Ref,
  772:     receive
  773:         Ref ->
  774:             do_pp_creations(pid, N - 1)
  775:     end;
  776: do_pp_creations(port, N) when is_integer(N) ->
  777:     %% Create new port and make sure it works...
  778:     "hej" = os:cmd("echo hej") -- "\n",
  779:     do_pp_creations(port, N - 1).
  780: 
  781: bad_nc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  782:     % Make sure emulator don't crash on bad node containers...
  783:     MaxPidNum = (1 bsl 15) - 1,
  784:     MaxPidSer = ?MAX_PIDS_PORTS bsr 15,
  785:     ThisNode = {node(), erlang:system_info(creation)},
  786:     {'EXIT', {badarg, mk_pid, _}}
  787:     = (catch mk_pid(ThisNode, MaxPidNum + 1, 17)),
  788:     {'EXIT', {badarg, mk_pid, _}}
  789:     = (catch mk_pid(ThisNode, 4711, MaxPidSer + 1)),
  790:     {'EXIT', {badarg, mk_port, _}}
  791:     = (catch mk_port(ThisNode, ?MAX_PIDS_PORTS + 1)),
  792:     {'EXIT', {badarg, mk_ref, _}}
  793:     = (catch mk_ref(ThisNode,[(1 bsl 18), 4711, 4711])),
  794:     {'EXIT', {badarg, mk_ref, _}}
  795:     = (catch mk_ref(ThisNode, [4711, 4711, 4711, 4711, 4711, 4711, 4711])),
  796:     RemNode = {x@y, 2},
  797:     {'EXIT', {badarg, mk_port, _}}
  798:     = (catch mk_port(RemNode, ?MAX_PIDS_PORTS + 1)),
  799:     {'EXIT', {badarg, mk_ref, _}}
  800:     = (catch mk_ref(RemNode, [(1 bsl 18), 4711, 4711])),
  801:     {'EXIT', {badarg, mk_ref, _}}
  802:     = (catch mk_ref(RemNode, [4711, 4711, 4711, 4711, 4711, 4711, 4711])),
  803:     BadNode = {x@y, bad_creation},
  804:     {'EXIT', {badarg, mk_pid, _}}
  805:     = (catch mk_pid(BadNode, 4711, 17)),
  806:     {'EXIT', {badarg, mk_port, _}}
  807:     = (catch mk_port(BadNode, 4711)),
  808:     {'EXIT', {badarg, mk_ref, _}}
  809:     = (catch mk_ref(BadNode, [4711, 4711, 17])),
  810: 
  811:     %% OTP 24:
  812:     mk_port({x@y, 4}, ?MAX_PIDS_PORTS + 1),
  813: 
  814:     %% OTP 24: External pids can use 32+32 bits
  815:     mk_pid(RemNode, MaxPidNum + 1, MaxPidSer),
  816:     mk_pid(RemNode, (1 bsl 32)-1, MaxPidSer),
  817:     mk_pid(RemNode, MaxPidNum, MaxPidSer + 1),
  818:     mk_pid(RemNode, MaxPidNum, (1 bsl 32)-1),
  819:     ok.
  820: 
  821: 
  822: 
  823: -define(NO_PIDS, 1000000).
  824: 
  825: unique_pid(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  826:     case catch erlang:system_info(modified_timing_level) of
  827:         Level when is_integer(Level) ->
  828:             {skip,
  829:              "Modified timing (level " ++ integer_to_list(Level)
  830:              ++ ") is enabled. spawn() is too slow for this "
  831:              " test when modified timing is enabled."};
  832:         _ ->
  833:             ?NO_PIDS = length(lists:usort(mkpidlist(?NO_PIDS, []))),
  834:             ok
  835:     end.
  836: 
  837: mkpidlist(0, Ps) -> Ps;
  838: mkpidlist(N, Ps) -> mkpidlist(N-1, [spawn(fun () -> ok end)|Ps]).
  839: 
  840: 
  841: iter_max_procs(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  842:     NoMoreTests = make_ref(),
  843:     erlang:send_after(10000, self(), NoMoreTests),
  844: 
  845:     %% Disable logging to avoid "Too many processes" log which can
  846:     %% cause ct_logs to crash when trying to spawn "async print job".
  847:     #{level := LoggerLevel} = logger:get_primary_config(),
  848:     ok = logger:set_primary_config(level, none),
  849:     Res = try
  850:               R = chk_max_proc_line(),
  851:               R = chk_max_proc_line(),
  852:               done = chk_max_proc_line_until(NoMoreTests, R),
  853:               R
  854:           after
  855:               logger:set_primary_config(level, LoggerLevel)
  856:           end,
  857:     Cmt = io_lib:format("max processes = ~p; "
  858:                         "process line length = ~p",
  859:                         [element(2, Res), element(1, Res)]),
  860:     {comment, lists:flatten(Cmt)}.
  861: 
  862: max_proc_line(Root, Parent, N) ->
  863:     Me = self(),
  864:     case catch spawn_link(fun () -> max_proc_line(Root, Me, N+1) end) of
  865:         {'EXIT', {system_limit, _}} when Root /= self() ->
  866:             Root ! {proc_line_length, N, self()},
  867:             receive remove_proc_line -> Parent ! {exiting, Me} end;
  868:         P when is_pid(P), Root =/= self() ->
  869:             receive {exiting, P} -> Parent ! {exiting, Me} end;
  870:         P when is_pid(P) ->
  871:             P;
  872:         Unexpected ->
  873:             exit({unexpected_spawn_result, Unexpected})
  874:     end.
  875: 
  876: chk_max_proc_line() ->
  877:     Child = max_proc_line(self(), self(), 0),
  878:     receive
  879:         {proc_line_length, PLL, End} ->
  880:             PC = erlang:system_info(process_count),
  881:             LP = length(processes()),
  882:             io:format("proc line length = ~p; "
  883:                       "process count = ~p; "
  884:                       "length processes = ~p~n",
  885:                       [PLL, PC, LP]),
  886:                   End ! remove_proc_line,
  887:                   PC = LP,
  888:                   receive {exiting, Child} -> ok end,
  889:                   {PLL, PC}
  890:     end.
  891: 
  892: chk_max_proc_line_until(NoMoreTests, Res) ->
  893:     receive
  894:         NoMoreTests ->
  895:             done
  896:     after 0 ->
  897:               Res = chk_max_proc_line(),
  898:               chk_max_proc_line_until(NoMoreTests, Res)
  899:     end.
  900: 
  901: magic_ref(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  902:     {MRef0, Addr0} = erts_debug:set_internal_state(make, magic_ref),
  903:     true = is_reference(MRef0),
  904:     {Addr0, 1, true} = erts_debug:get_internal_state({magic_ref,MRef0}),
  905:     MRef1 = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(MRef0)),
  906:     {Addr0, 2, true} = erts_debug:get_internal_state({magic_ref,MRef1}),
  907:     MRef0 = MRef1,
  908:     Me = self(),
  909:     {Pid, Mon} = spawn_opt(fun () ->
  910: 				   receive
  911: 				       {Me, MRef} ->
  912: 					   Me ! {self(), erts_debug:get_internal_state({magic_ref,MRef})}
  913: 				   end
  914: 			   end,
  915: 			   [link, monitor]),
  916:     Pid ! {self(), MRef0},
  917:     receive
  918: 	{Pid, Info} ->
  919: 	    {Addr0, 3, true} = Info
  920:     end,
  921:     receive
  922: 	{'DOWN', Mon, process, Pid, _} ->
  923: 	    ok
  924:     end,
  925:     MaxTime = erlang:monotonic_time(millisecond) + 1000,
  926:     %% The DOWN signal is sent before heap is cleaned up,
  927:     %% so we might need to wait some time after the DOWN
  928:     %% signal has been received before the heap actually
  929:     %% has been cleaned up...
  930:     wait_until(fun () ->
  931:                        case erts_debug:get_internal_state({magic_ref,MRef0}) of
  932:                            {Addr0, 2, true} ->
  933:                                true;
  934:                            {Addr0, 3, true} ->
  935:                                true = MaxTime >= erlang:monotonic_time(millisecond),
  936:                                false;
  937:                            Error ->
  938:                                ct:fail(Error)
  939:                        end
  940:                end),
  941:     id(MRef0),
  942:     id(MRef1),
  943:     MRefExt = term_to_binary(erts_debug:set_internal_state(make, magic_ref)),
  944:     garbage_collect(),
  945:     {MRef2, _Addr2} = binary_to_term(MRefExt),
  946:     true = is_reference(MRef2),
  947:     true = erts_debug:get_internal_state({magic_ref,MRef2}),
  948:     ok.
  949: 
  950: persistent_term(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  951:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  952:     Self = self(),
  953:     NcData = make_ref(),
  954:     RPid = spawn_link(Node,
  955:                       fun () ->
  956:                               Self ! {NcData, self(), hd(erlang:ports()), erlang:make_ref()}
  957:                       end),
  958:     Data = receive
  959:                {NcData, RPid, RPort, RRef} ->
  960:                    {RPid, RPort, RRef}
  961:            end,
  962:     unlink(RPid),
  963:     stop_node(Peer, Node),
  964:     Stuff = lists:foldl(fun (N, Acc) ->
  965:                                 persistent_term:put({?MODULE, N}, Data),
  966:                                 persistent_term:erase({?MODULE, N-1}),
  967:                                 node_container_refc_check(node()),
  968:                                 Data = persistent_term:get({?MODULE, N}),
  969:                                 try
  970:                                     persistent_term:get({?MODULE, N-1})
  971:                                 catch
  972:                                     error:badarg ->
  973:                                         ok
  974:                                 end,
  975:                                 case N rem 4 of
  976:                                     0 -> [persistent_term:get({?MODULE, N})|Acc];
  977:                                     _ -> Acc
  978:                                 end
  979:                         end,
  980:                         [],
  981:                         lists:seq(1, 100)),
  982:     persistent_term:erase({?MODULE, 100}),
  983:     receive after 2000 -> ok end, %% give literal gc some time to run...
  984:     node_container_refc_check(node()),
  985:     id(Stuff),
  986:     ok.
  987: 
  988: 
  989: lost_pending_connection(Node) ->
  990:     _ = (catch erts_internal:new_connection(Node)),
  991:     ok.
  992: 
  993: dist_entry_gc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  994:     Me = self(),
  995:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["+zdntgc", "0"]),
  996:     P = spawn_link(Node,
  997:                    fun () ->
  998:                            LostNode = list_to_atom("lost_pending_connection@" ++ hostname()),
  999:                            lost_pending_connection(LostNode),
 1000:                            garbage_collect(), %% Could crash...
 1001:                            Me ! {self(), ok}
 1002:                    end),
 1003:     receive
 1004:         {P, ok} -> ok
 1005:     end,
 1006:     unlink(P),
 1007:     stop_node(Peer, Node),
 1008:     ok.
 1009: 
 1010: huge_ref(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1011:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
 1012:     HRef = mk_ref({Node, 4711}, [4711, 705676, 3456, 1000000, 3456]),
 1013:     io:format("HRef=~p~n", [HRef]),
 1014:     HRef = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(HRef)),
 1015:     HRef = erpc:call(Node, fun () -> HRef end),
 1016:     peer:stop(Peer),
 1017:     ok.
 1018: 
 1019: %%
 1020: %% -- Internal utils ---------------------------------------------------------
 1021: %%
 1022: 
 1023: id(X) ->
 1024:     X.
 1025: 
 1026: -define(ND_REFS, erts_debug:get_internal_state(node_and_dist_references)).
 1027: 
 1028: node_container_refc_check(Node) when is_atom(Node) ->
 1029:     AIS = erts_test_utils:available_internal_state(true),
 1030:     nc_refc_check(Node),
 1031:     erts_test_utils:available_internal_state(AIS).
 1032: 
 1033: nc_refc_check(Node) when is_atom(Node) ->
 1034:     Ref = make_ref(),
 1035:     Self = self(),
 1036:     io:format("Starting reference count check of node ~w~n", [Node]),
 1037:     Pid = spawn_link(
 1038:             Node,
 1039:             fun () ->
 1040:                     erts_test_utils:check_node_dist(
 1041:                       fun (ErrMsg) ->
 1042:                               Self ! {Ref, ErrMsg, failed},
 1043:                               exit(normal)
 1044:                       end),
 1045:                     Self ! {Ref, succeeded}
 1046:             end),
 1047:     receive
 1048:         {Ref, ErrorMsg, failed} ->
 1049:             io:format("~s~n", [ErrorMsg]),
 1050:             ct:fail(reference_count_check_failed);
 1051:         {Ref, succeeded} ->
 1052:             io:format("Reference count check of node ~w succeeded!~n", [Node]),
 1053:             unlink(Pid),
 1054:             ok
 1055:     end.
 1056: 
 1057: get_node_references({NodeName, Creation} = Node) when is_atom(NodeName),
 1058:                                                       is_integer(Creation) ->
 1059:     {{node_references, NodeRefs},
 1060:      {dist_references, DistRefs}} = ?ND_REFS,
 1061:     erts_test_utils:check_node_dist(
 1062:       fun (ErrMsg) ->
 1063:               io:format("~s", [ErrMsg]),
 1064:               ct:fail(reference_count_check_failed)
 1065:       end,
 1066:       NodeRefs, DistRefs),
 1067:     find_references(Node, NodeRefs).
 1068: 
 1069: get_dist_references(NodeName) when is_atom(NodeName) ->
 1070:     {{node_references, NodeRefs},
 1071:      {dist_references, DistRefs}} = ?ND_REFS,
 1072:     erts_test_utils:check_node_dist(fun (ErrMsg) ->
 1073:                                             io:format("~s", [ErrMsg]),
 1074:                                             ct:fail(reference_count_check_failed)
 1075:                                     end,
 1076:                                     NodeRefs, DistRefs),
 1077:     find_references(NodeName, DistRefs).
 1078: 
 1079: find_references(N, NRefList) ->
 1080:     case lists:keysearch(N, 1, NRefList) of
 1081:         {value, {N, _, ReferrersList}} -> ReferrersList;
 1082:         _ -> false
 1083:     end.
 1084: 
 1085: %% Currently unused
 1086: % refering_entity_type(RefererType, ReferingEntities) ->
 1087: %     lists:filter(fun ({{RT, _}, _}) when RT == RefererType ->
 1088: % 			 true;
 1089: % 		     (_) ->
 1090: % 			 false
 1091: % 		 end,
 1092: % 		 ReferingEntities).
 1093: 
 1094: refering_entity_id(ReferingEntityId, [{ReferingEntityId,_} = ReferingEntity
 1095:                                       | _ReferingEntities]) ->
 1096:     ReferingEntity;
 1097: refering_entity_id(ReferingEntityId, [_ | ReferingEntities]) ->
 1098:     refering_entity_id(ReferingEntityId, ReferingEntities);
 1099: refering_entity_id(_, []) ->
 1100:     false.
 1101: 
 1102: reference_type_count(_, false) ->
 1103:     0;
 1104: reference_type_count(Type, {_, _ReferenceCountList} = ReferingEntity) ->
 1105:     reference_type_count(Type, [ReferingEntity]);
 1106: reference_type_count(Type, ReferingEntities) when is_list(ReferingEntities) ->
 1107:     lists:foldl(fun ({_, ReferenceCountList}, Acc1) ->
 1108:                         lists:foldl(fun ({T, N}, Acc2) when T == Type ->
 1109:                                             N + Acc2;
 1110:                                         (_, Acc2) ->
 1111:                                             Acc2
 1112:                                     end,
 1113:                                     Acc1,
 1114:                                     ReferenceCountList)
 1115:                 end,
 1116:                 0,
 1117:                 ReferingEntities).
 1118: 
 1119: stop_node(Peer, Node) ->
 1120:     nc_refc_check(Node),
 1121:     peer:stop(Peer).
 1122: 
 1123: hostname() ->
 1124:     from($@, atom_to_list(node())).
 1125: 
 1126: from(H, [H | T]) -> T;
 1127: from(H, [_ | T]) -> from(H, T);
 1128: from(_H, []) -> [].
 1129: 
 1130: wait_until(Pred) ->
 1131:     case Pred() of
 1132:         true -> ok;
 1133:         false -> receive after 100 -> wait_until(Pred) end
 1134:     end.
 1135: 
 1136: get_nodefirstname_string() ->
 1137:     atom_to_list(?MODULE)
 1138:     ++ "-"
 1139:     ++ integer_to_list(erlang:system_time(second))
 1140:     ++ "-"
 1141:     ++ integer_to_list(erlang:unique_integer([positive])).
 1142: 
 1143: get_nodename() ->
 1144:     list_to_atom(get_nodefirstname_string()
 1145:                  ++ "@"
 1146:                  ++ hostname()).
 1147: 
 1148: mk_pid({NodeName, Creation}, Number, Serial) ->
 1149:     erts_test_utils:mk_ext_pid({NodeName, Creation}, Number, Serial).
 1150: 
 1151: mk_port({NodeName, Creation}, Number) ->
 1152:     erts_test_utils:mk_ext_port({NodeName, Creation}, Number).
 1153: 
 1154: mk_ref({NodeName, Creation}, Numbers) ->
 1155:     erts_test_utils:mk_ext_ref({NodeName, Creation}, Numbers).
 1156: 
 1157: 
 1158: exec_loop() ->
 1159:     receive
 1160:         {exec_fun, Fun} when is_function(Fun) ->
 1161:             Fun();
 1162:         {sync_exec_fun, From, Fun} when is_pid(From), is_function(Fun)  ->
 1163:             From ! {sync_exec_fun_res, self(), Fun()}
 1164:     end,
 1165:     exec_loop().
 1166: 
 1167: spawn_execer(Node) ->
 1168:     spawn(Node, fun () -> exec_loop() end).
 1169: 
 1170: spawn_link_execer(Node) ->
 1171:     spawn_link(Node, fun () -> exec_loop() end).
 1172: 
 1173: exec(Pid, Fun) when is_pid(Pid), is_function(Fun) ->
 1174:     Pid ! {exec_fun, Fun}.
 1175: 
 1176: sync_exec(Pid, Fun) when is_pid(Pid), is_function(Fun) ->
 1177:     Pid ! {sync_exec_fun, self(), Fun},
 1178:     receive
 1179:         {sync_exec_fun_res, Pid, Res} ->
 1180:             Res
 1181:     end.
